result.execSummary:
The defendant Jario E. Ramos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Existing sentence currently being served.

miscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Defendant to comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:40 PM: Defendant Jario E. Ramos in court with attorney William M Lennon.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement on resolution recited by Atty Lennon.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.   Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. ADA states confusion remains on restitution that may need to be clarified at a later hearing. No initial claim rec'd from victim, though monies were paid by RCGI in the amount of $500.00 that needs clarification. Per Atty Lennon:  It was the understanding that Def would not be responsible for any restitution.  Adm sanction called for payment of $500.00 paid directly to RCGI - does not believe that any further restitution should be ordered - Victim is not entitled to any payment by Defendant.   Court accepts State's motion to amend to Misd Battery contrary 940.19(1) Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  Atty Lennon states for the record the sanctions imposed by RCGI due to this incident - severe sanction received.  Statement by Captain of RGCI as to Adm sanction of $500 imposed.  The Court: Adopts recommendation imposed  S/W - 1 yr probation. Probation is consecutive to any sentence that is now existing (after)  probation to commence when current incarceration ends.  Defendant argues against any consecutive sentence.  Court not imposing a consecutive sentence only consecutive to parole - one add'l year of supervision. Court retracts consecutive term of probation and will run concurrent with existing sentence. Conditions:  Court Costs plus DNA Surcharge - any costs paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings while incarcerated;  any counseling as deemed appropriate; in light of Adm order imposed, will not order any Restitution to victim.  Appeal Rights Given.
Summary of Restitution- $500.00
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum

Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case called @ 2:41 p.m. Defendant Jario E. Ramos in court with attorney William M. Lennon.  Defendant Jario E. Ramos in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG plea entered. The defendant has submitted a request for prompt disposition. Court orders $5000 Sig Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
